misuses.description: The encrypt() method is using a deprecated SSL/TLS version for the connection. This can leave the connection vulnerable to attacks such as the Logjam attack.
misuses.recommendation: Update the SSL/TLS version to a more secure and up-to-date version, such as TLS 1.2.

misuses.description: The encrypt() method is using a fixed random seed for the SSL/TLS connection. This can make the connection more predictable and easier to attack.
misuses.recommendation: Use a more secure and unpredictable randomness source, such as a cryptographically secure pseudo-random number generator.

misuses.description: The encrypt() method is using hard-coded credentials for the SSL/TLS connection. This can make the connection vulnerable to unauthorized access.
misuses.recommendation: Do not use hard-coded credentials, instead use a secure and secure way of storing and retrieving credentials, such as a secure storage service or environment variables.

misuses.description: The encrypt() method is using default values for some of the SSL/TLS connection settings, such as the cipher suite or the protocol version. This can make the connection less secure than it could be.
misuses.recommendation: Do not use default values for SSL/TLS connection settings, instead explicitly set the values to a secure and up-to-date configuration.
